Projects discontinued.

Topic closed.

Use [thread=18321]Seaplane Floats addon[/thread] instead.

Abandonware. Do whatever you like with the models.

H&S Tinkering Workshop humbly presents

Amphibious Landing Gear

and

'Drone' UAV

v2.6

Amphibious Gear enables a plane to land virtually anywhere -- on grass, on snow and on water. Moreover it's far more durable than old C7 landing gear and can withstand landing speed of more than 180 m/s. The kit contains long and short Fuselage Skids, Wing Skids and inflatable Hydroplane Pontoons.

Landing Skids are made of plywood; they're rather worn though still firm. 'Standard' Fuselage Skid may carry 2 to 3 Hydroplane Pontoons, 'short' version carries 1 or 2 while Wing Skid ('left' and 'right' versions are included) carries one. Warning: if you're using only two fuselage skids (and no wing skids at all) then each of them must carry not less than 2 pontoons for the plane to float stably.

Highly buoyant inflatable Hydroplane Pontoon was cautiously stolen up at KNN base at Kermenia. Dunno what those marines are using these pontoons for, but tie it to your landing skid -- and you're ready to land anywhere! Warning: use with HSTW skids only.

Download 1.1 Mb (must be logged in)

v0.15 Compatibility Note: pontoons are hard to place in the SpacePlane Hangar; you'll need to rotate them a bit with <Shift + WASDQE> keys. This is the game's issue, not an addon's one ('cause these pontoons work perfectly in the Vehicle Assembly Building); game devs are well aware of it, but currently have no solution.

Craft design suggestions:

'Drone' UAV is a fully autonomous airplane with almost unlimited range. After an aerial launch it stabilizes at 2 500 meters and 100 m/s -- and then travels perfectly straight. The Drone may be used as a reconnaissance vehicle or as a target for shooting practice.

The pack consists of a fuselage equipped with a solid rocket engine, ejection rack to attach the fuselage to you carrier plane, long wing and two tailfins -- 'left' and 'right' ones (not interchangeable).

  • attach the fuselage to an ejection rack below your airplane,
  • place wings with x2 symmetry at the marked spots in the middle of fuselage,
  • then attach tailfins to the spots at the tail matching 'L' and 'R' letters on the fins to those on the fuselage.

Below is the picture of correctly assembled Drone:

Download 280 Kb (must be logged in)

v0.15 Compatibility Note: open Parts/hstwDroneRack/part.cfg with Notepad and manually increase rack's ejectionForce to 100 or something.

Thanks to Iskierka who fine-tuned drone's aerodynamics the plane flies perfectly well no matter the launch conditions. Launch altitude of 500 m and speed of 70 m/s are recommended but not necessary. Just don't turn it upside-down!
